titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ron Whyte Papers
titlestmt.author: by Danijela True and Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:53

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, printed material, photographs, audiovisual material, and personal papers that document the life and work of playwright, editor, and activist Ron Whyte (circa 1942-1989). The largest series, Writings, includes drafts and circulating versions of dozens of works of drama and prose by Ron Whyte, including many unproduced plays. The documentation of Whyte's writings also includes material from his time as a student, spanning from high school to graduate study at the Yale School of Drama and the Union Theological Seminary. The papers also include a substantial quantity of audio recordings of dramatic works written or produced by Whyte. Other material, including subject files and unsorted papers, documents the varied and prolific career of Whyte, including his advocacy for people with disabilities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 138-159: (reel-to-reel audiotapes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

Boxes 105, 111, 112, 115, 160-167 (record albums, audiocassettes, and videocassettes): Use of original is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Ron Whyte Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ron Whyte Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing in 2007, and again in 2012, including rehousing and minimal organization.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into ten series: I. Correspondence, 1939-1994. II. Writings, 1957-1995. III. Educational Papers, 1956-1984. IV. Professional Papers, 1962-1995. V. Subject Files, 1957-1989. VI. Personal Papers, 1950-1989. VII. Printed Material, 1939-1985. VIII. Photographs, 1953-1991. IX. Unsorted Papers, circa 1967-1990. X. Audiovisual Material, circa 1973-1980.

bioghist.head: Ron Whyte
bioghist.p: Ron Whyte (circa 1942-1989), American playwright and book review editor for the Soho Weekly News , was the author of the plays Welcome to Andromeda (1969) and Disability: A Comedy (1978), and the executive director of the National Task Force for Disability and the Arts, 1977-1980. Ron Whyte's year of birth is variously recorded as 1941 or 1942.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, printed material, photographs, audiovisual material, and personal papers that document the life and work of playwright, editor, and activist Ron Whyte. The largest series, Writings, includes drafts and circulating versions of dozens of works of drama and prose by Ron Whyte, including many unproduced plays. The documentation of Whyte's writings also includes material from his time as a student, spanning from high school to graduate study at the Yale School of Drama and the Union Theological Seminary. The papers also include a substantial quantity of audio recordings of dramatic works written or produced by Whyte. Other material, including subject files and unsorted papers, documents the varied and prolific career of Whyte, including his advocacy for people with disabilities.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists chiefly of incoming correspondence, though files occasionally include notes or drafts of outgoing correspondence. The files are unsorted and include both personal and professional correspondence with colleagues, family members, and organizations, relating to Ron Whyte's writing, the production of his dramatic works, and his work as an activist; to broader cultural and literary events and topics, especially as they relate to the New York City area; and to personal, financial, and medical issues.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Writings of Ron Whyte, and Writings of Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists chiefly of drafts of writings, most typescript, some corrected. Some files also include notes and other related material. Writings of Ron Whyte are chiefly dramatic works, but also include reviews and other works of prose. Notes and Notebooks include drafts of unidentified writings, lectures, and notes relating to various writing and editing projects. Writings of Others appear to consist of material that was sent to Ron Whyte for his review or editorial input, and versions of dramatic works produced by Ron Whyte.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under three headings: Major Works of Drama and Prose, Notes and Notebooks, and Reviews.

did.unittitle: Major Works of Drama and Prose

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title. Untitled and unsorted works are filed at the end.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: General Professional Papers, Grant Proposals, and Papers of Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV consists of notes, ephemera, copies of printed material, and grant applications associated with Ron Whyte's disability activism and other public service. Also included are professional papers of others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boxes 100-108: Titles are transcribed from Ron Whyte's original files.
Series V consists of Ron Whyte's files on topics relating to his research, writing, and activism. Files include notes, copies of printed material, and correspondence.

scopecontent.p: Series VI consists of appointment and address books, phone messages, financial records, drawings, and other papers and ephemera that document Ron Whyte's personal life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VII consists of clippings, articles, and photocopies of printed material relating to Ron Whyte and to cultural and literary topics that intersect with his writing and work.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VIII consists of photographic prints and slides relating to Ron Whyte's personal and professional life and include portraits of actors, snapshots of dramatic performances and rehearsals, and snapshots of Ron Whyte, and family and friends of Ron Whyte. Most subjects of photographs are not identified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Purdy's article "The Violet Velvet Violence"

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IX consists of unsorted notes, correspondence, ephemera, and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series X consists chiefly of recordings of productions of dramatic performances, presumably of works written or produced by Ron Whyte. Many tapes include identifying information on their boxes.
